The messages on the sermon on the mount. Start at the bottom right of the page for the first one and then watch chronologically by date.


There are seven elements of design
There are eight principles
You set up a matrix. Too many choices immobilize.
What forces you to creativity is to put strong boundaries around your process
It’s that “what if” that leads you down trails that open up avenues
Maximally beautiful pieces came when she created chaos all over her canvas
Step back, look at the chaos, what you do see, what can you find that’s useful? 
That process is terrifying
This is the hero’s journey. Art and fear are bound together. Book (Art and Fear by Orland and Bayles https://www.amazon.com/dp/0961454733/ref=cm_sw_r_cp_tai_AniaDb81ZYWA3)
Elements and principles of design maps onto all these disciplines
And helps to make sense of the difficult concepts in Maps of Meaning
Jordan Peterson’s reluctance to say he believes in God
Neil Turok “the simplicity of everything”
The imaginary number opened up worlds of information
Jonathan Pageau, Jesus is the axis, no beginning and no end, going straight up to infinity, also moving up and down on the axis
We are like the asymptote approaching but not reaching His perfection
Everyone is somewhere on the string moving towards more skill or growth or maturity
Exponentiate a real number gives an asymptote. Exponentiate the imaginary number I gives a Circle. Each of us is somewhere on a string that starts on the Circle and moves asymptotically in and up closer to Christ as He fills us and we mature in Him
As we get closer to Christ we get closer to each other
There are hierarchies in every discipline, Jesus is the axis of each. he’s the great engineer, artist, physicist, etc. 
John Ortberg, series on the sermon on the mount
History
Sy Garte bio chemist on twitter
The cells of our body need solar input. We can’t be our own sun. 
We are faced with this field of infinite potential and we need to make choices
Everytime we make a choice we build the future in front of us
In the same way the Universe is expanding into something that is the future
It’s not only energy that makes that future but also ideas
Some of the choices are actions, or ideas, we pluck information out of the universe to build the future. Every discipline (system) has built its structure out of that information. The maximally divisible choices of unique individuals build the future one choice at a time (here is one via connecting to the big idea in calculus)
Jesus Christ is the way, the truth and the life. The future spooled forth from that idea
God spoke at the beginning of time
The speaking that is from His book
The speaking that is from nature
Spoken word must be heard to be useful
Can spoken truth bring forth bad things?
